comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Prince Pu Lun, nephew of the Emperor? query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F7071FFB39541B728... www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2006678578/ indianapublicmedia.org/momentofindianahistory/motorcade-f...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: It is certainly Pu Lun (caption on the photo says PU, not PI). In 1904 he was the Chinese envoy at the St. Louis exposition, see p.e. The St. Louis Republic., May 07, 1904, Page 8. There was even an advertising with his face: The St. Louis Republic., May 29, 1904, PART I, Page 10. Date on photograph says 1912 (?) at the bottom and 12/20/15 on the sticker. There are some references of him in the newspapers of 1912, e.g. The Mathews journal., February 01, 1912, Image 6 column 5. Unclear what happened in 1915. Pu Lun was executed in 1917 (according to The Ogden standard., July 05, 1917, 4 P.M. CITY EDITION, Image 1, last column) (PS: this report seems to be a canard, see below)

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: He wears the sash and star of the Japanese Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum that country's highest order founded in 1876. Wikipedia does not include him in their list of recipients.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: On December 16, 1915, the New York times ran a dispatch from Peking stating that Pu Lun had been made Chairman of the Council of State. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40712F7395D1673... However, that report of Pu Lun's execution appears to be in error. Prince Pu Lun's name is now commonly transliterated as Pulun. Here is a Chinese wikipedia entry for Pulun, 11/10/1874-1/21/1927, who was the envoy to the St. Louis world's fair in 1904. zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%BA%A5%E5%80%AB) Late Qing dynasty family tree: books.google.com/books?id=tgq1miGno-4C&lpg=PA238&...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for this excellent research. And he's already represented in our collections! We'll correct the spelling in the caption and add some of this information the next time we update.
